text:
Thanks all. Just so everyone is aware, the plan for the day is as follows: Melodee is working on specing Onboarding while Trent is working on cleaning up the calendar spec and passing off PSD's to Philip and Ali, once that is complete he'll move onto documenting how he sees motion playing out throughout the rest of the App. Ali & Philip are jamming completing the Android pass on all things Disco related as they are already done with their respective sections. At the end of the day we're going to triple check that anything in Dropbox is the most up to date and if not it's marked as pending. 
Leah is working on putting together the Global Spec documentation which should be done by mid day today. Before everyone leaves we'll print out any comps that have changed this week (an example being the calendar view) and replace what is currently on the boards in the social space.
thanks for the recap Jenna

One thing I’d like to make sure we do in terms of any Android pass is to make triple sure that we’re adhering to Material guidelines as much as possible. There’s interaction patterns that we’ll need to adapt, some placements that we’ll need to adapt. And of course, an overall brand voice that we’ll need to make sure is intact. 

That’s all probably already accounted for, but wanted to say it out loud just in case. Think the Android process in particular will require significant collaboration between UX, visuals, and our dev teams — so please please please make sure you’re all chatting together. 

I know this particular part of the project has been on <@U0261PCRQ>’s mind — so please reach out to her as much as possible (not to sign you up for anything kat!)

I am going through current screens to do a content audit for our copywriter. I’ll call out any tweaks that may need to be made but they’re likely to be minor and I believe we already have the framework in place to accommodate most if not all potential updates. Just making sure that the comps match the wires in terms of content buckets. There’s currently only one piece of copy that was in wires that we’re missing.
<https://material.google.com/>

attachments.title: Introduction - Material design - Google design guidelines
attachments.fallback: Google design guidelines: Introduction - Material design - Google design guidelines

text: Feel free to chat with me or elise or leah if you have questions on Material Design interactions/patterns
Agreed. That site is a good place to start, but I think working together is an even better way to go about it. Please talk!
i was bothering kat all day yesterday :thumbsup:
Excellent and thank you! It’s one of the remaining parts of Compass that I want to make sure we do right - which will pull from everyone’s skill sets. Collaboration is key, so thank you
<@U0265G76F>: Yes, we’ve all been chatting with Kat to make sure everything is covered for Android! Thanks for checking in on that front.
<@U02AUNA0P> / <@U0XCJ372R> do you guys have some time today to run me through your android wires? it’s ok if theyre still in progress
<@U0260V1BX>: I should have the time
yeah i should have time as well
k thanks. dont want to eat too much time up, I’ll pop by your desks in a bit

<@U02AUNA0P>: <@U026E0ZNR> <@U0MKH0BE0> <@U0XCJ372R> Hi! Just want to triple check we’re using a consistent naming convention. Please make sure your designs match wireframe #’s. Ex: Wireframe is 5.1.2 your design should match so it’s easy for Dev’s to compare. Thankkkk you! Let me know if this doesn’t make sense :slightly_smiling_face:

Also-since we’ll be finishing everything up today Leah and I thought it would be a good idea to do a quick retrospective on the production process this past week…what you liked, what you didn’t like & what you’d change. Shouldn’t take more than 20 or so minutes. I’ll set this up for Monday afternoon!
<@U0U9WJB7F>: i’d love to join that as well
<@U0U9WJB7F>: me too
okay great!
I know my comps need to be renamed. I had to change the numbers in settings to keep the in order for when I was trying to share them on the phone and in other places.

<@U0MKH0BE0|melodee> uploaded a file: <https://uncorked.slack.com/files/melodee/F1WJL2G7J/img_5107.jpg|IMG_5107.JPG> and commented: <@U1A1A9L7N>: <@U0XCJ372R>  is there new type style guide we can share? This old one is a bit confusing

initial_comment.comment: <@U1A1A9L7N>: <@U0XCJ372R>  is there new type style guide we can share? This old one is a bit confusing

text: <@U1A1A9L7N|leah> uploaded a file: <https://uncorked.slack.com/files/leah/F1WJR3JF8/compass_devglobalspec.pdf|Compass_DevGlobalSpec.pdf>
Use this version.
Thanks!

*EOD Update:*
• Edit iOS specs for Dx and I handed those off to Phillip to do android specs (thanks for that)
• I've shared those on the google drive: <https://drive.google.com/open?id=0B8Nqz7v9YgvVc3JXbjhPSHF0cDA>
• Minor changes  in my discovery screens
• Shared those changes on the drive as well as dropbox
• Latest screens (onboarding & dx) are printed and pinned in social space
• I’ve also shared onboarding screen on dropbox

All my screens are here: <https://drive.google.com/open?id=0B66xlOzM3iA-dHN2R2piRklocVU>

*WIP:* I’ll be working on this over the weekend 
• Android specs and iOS specs for onboarding

EOD update:

• did global header spec for iOS/android (thanks kat!)
• helped melodee out with spec
• printed and pinned latest comps
• uploaded latest spec to drive, and latest comps to dropbox

What I did:

• Cleaned up visuals and pinned updates to board
• Adjusted daily progress dots to fall in one line rather than two
• Changed “Download All Sessions” button to align with existing small button style
• Updated/refined all key screen spec sheets
• Began an inventory of potential motion/transitions within the app
• Put everything in Drive and Dropbox folders

Next week is motion time

<@U1A1A9L7N|leah> uploaded a file: <https://uncorked.slack.com/files/leah/F1WKL7R1N/07292016_compass_devglobalspec.pdf|07292016_Compass_DevGlobalSpec.pdf> and commented: <!channel>: Here’s the current spec. We need to update a couple type IDs on Monday but it should be easy - it’s literally swapping 2 IDs. Let’s review Monday morning. Awesome work from everyone. Have a great weekend! :slightly_smiling_face:
